CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 28, 1955, pg. 5, reads: "Waitresses Kick-Off - Pittsburgh's 'Most Popular Waitress' contest was kicked off to a rousing start last Sunday with a cocktail party sponsored by the Bantu Men's Club in lounge of Club Forty-nine. Seated left to right: Geraldine Coleman, Rosen's, Court Place; Margaret Griffin, Colonial Inn; Betty Brown, Skyrocket; Vernell Evans, wardrobe adviser; Marcella Young, hair stylist; Mildred Jones, Club Forty-nine; Arzetta Falconer, Yellins; and Joan Bennett Allen, Paramount, Coraopolis.  Standing: Becky Jefferson, Hurricane; Beulah Woods, Musician's Club; Lucille Wooden, Casablanca; Williamer Moore, Ionic Club, Steubenville; Carl Redwood, Hill City, speaker; Margaret Williams, Med-Center; Bell Fox, Mason's Grill; Pauline Thompson, Ellis Smoke Shop, Steubenville, and Alma Dulin. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait seated from left: Geraldine Coleman, Margaret Griffin, Betty Brown, Vernell Evans, Marcella Young, Mildred Jones, Arzetta Falconer, Joan Bennett Allen; standing: Becky Jefferson, Beulah Woods, Lucille Wooden, Williamer Moore, Carl Redwood, Margaret Williams, Bell Fox, Pauline Thompson, and Alma Dulin, gathered at Club Fort-nine tto kick off Pittsburgh's "Most Popular Waitress" contest
